alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 3:42AM PDT until March 13 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches mainly along the crest of the Cascades and passes while lower elevations could see 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels Monday morning will begin around 4500 to 5500 feet and then lower on Monday afternoon as a cold front pushes through the region. Most of the snow impacting travel over the passes will occur Monday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
